headline: Microsoft Selects Eyelit Technologies to Power Lab Traceability and Quality Initiatives
summary: HOLMDEL, N.J., January 14, 2026--Eyelit Technologies (Eyelit), a leader in optimized planning, scheduling, and execution systems for manufacturers, today announced that Microsoft has selected its Manufacturing Operations Management (MOM) Solution Suite to support traceability and quality across multiple labs around the globe. Anchored by Eyelit’s MES and QMS modules, the implementation is designed to address complex semiconductor and specialty processing workflows at scale.

content.title: Microsoft Selects Eyelit Technologies to Power Lab Traceability and Quality Initiatives
content.summary: HOLMDEL, N.J., January 14, 2026--Eyelit Technologies (Eyelit), a leader in optimized planning, scheduling, and execution systems for manufacturers, today announced that Microsoft has selected its Manufacturing Operations Management (MOM) Solution Suite to support traceability and quality across multiple labs around the globe. Anchored by Eyelit’s MES and QMS modules, the implementation is designed to address complex semiconductor and specialty processing workflows at scale.

headline: Malaysia Data Center Market Investment Analysis Report 2026-2031: Cyberjaya Emerges as the Country's Leading Hub for Hyperscale and Cloud Expansion
summary: The Malaysia Data Center Market is set to grow from USD 6.14 billion in 2025 to USD 11.40 billion by 2031, at a CAGR of 10.86%. Cyberjaya leads with 22+ existing and 9 upcoming centers, fueled by the government's Green Data Center Guidelines promoting energy-efficient solutions. Construction costs, ranging from $8 to $10 million per MW, are competitive yet expected to rise yearly. New power tariffs may increase data center operations' energy costs by 10%-14%. headline: Rubicon Carbon to Supply Microsoft with Two Million Tonnes of Carbon Removal Credits from Kijani Forestry Project
summary: MARINA DEL REY, Calif., January 14, 2026--Rubicon Carbon, a vertically integrated carbon credit investment and management firm, signed an agreement to deliver two million high-quality Afforestation, Reforestation, and Revegetation (ARR) credits to Microsoft over nine years. The credits will be sourced through 2035 from Kijani Forestry’s Smallholder Farmer Forestry Project, which is one of the first to be approved under Uganda’s Climate Change Mechanisms Regulations.

content.title: Rubicon Carbon to Supply Microsoft with Two Million Tonnes of Carbon Removal Credits from Kijani Forestry Project
content.summary: MARINA DEL REY, Calif., January 14, 2026--Rubicon Carbon, a vertically integrated carbon credit investment and management firm, signed an agreement to deliver two million high-quality Afforestation, Reforestation, and Revegetation (ARR) credits to Microsoft over nine years. The credits will be sourced through 2035 from Kijani Forestry’s Smallholder Farmer Forestry Project, which is one of the first to be approved under Uganda’s Climate Change Mechanisms Regulations.

headline: Strategy, Other Stocks to Buy Amid Software Selloff: Technical Analysis
summary: Trends can persist longer than many expect, and some of the megacap software leaders will need to start pulling their weight if the group is to regain leadership.  Microsoft  the largest holding in the iShares software ETF at nearly 9%, is still working through the aftermath of a four-week skid into late November that erased nearly 100 points from the stock.  As 2026 begins, selective software names are showing pockets of resilience and relative strength, finding potential support and suggesting that leadership within the group may be narrow, but not absent.

content.title: Strategy, Other Stocks to Buy Amid Software Selloff: Technical Analysis

As 2026 begins, selective software names are showing pockets of resilience and relative strength, finding potential support and suggesting that leadership within the group may be narrow, but not absent.

headline: 2026’s Biggest AI Trends: The Rise of AI Factories | VRT Stock, NVT Stock, MOD Stock
summary: 24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics. In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

content.title: 2026’s Biggest AI Trends: The Rise of AI Factories | VRT Stock, NVT Stock, MOD Stock
content.description:
24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics.

In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. 

Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.
content.summary: 24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics. In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

headline: ‘Sickening and greedy’: California millionaire slams Larry Page and Sergey Brin for cutting ties with the state to avoid wealth tax
summary: As billionaires flee the state to avoid the proposed wealth tax, other high earners support the one-time tax.

content.title: ‘Sickening and greedy’: California millionaire slams Larry Page and Sergey Brin for cutting ties with the state to avoid wealth tax
